multiplechoiceresponse.p: If you wanted to reduce the length of the underline by half (50%) in the CSS example below:
Which attribute would you need to change and what would you change it to?

div.p: The underline on the headers on this page are created as a bottom border. The width of that bottom border is the length of the underline.

This is a great example of a common css solution that might seem strange at first. The CSS text-decoration property is what one might use to set an underline on a single word, but it stops at the edge of the word. A bottom border can go partway across the page, or can stop before the end of the text... but it isn't aware of the size of the text. CSS often involves tradeoffs.
